text: all of the items in my pantry and
Chewy's are the ones that bail me out
most frequently
if you had anchovies - something as
simple as say chicken thighs you can
transform it from okay this is quick
after work food - this is company food
the first thing is to make the pan sauce
then you add the chicken I've got garlic
cloves that I've just smashed and peeled
and I've got my anchovies I've got
capers and then a pinch of red pepper
you want everything to get kind of brown
and then the anchovies are just going to
dissolve I'm just gonna mash them up a
little bit see this is what you're
looking for you just want them to get
brown around the edges just like that
and now I'm gonna add the chicken to the
pan and get that nice and brown as well
there's that salt and pepper on this you
really want to season your chicken ahead
that gives a chicken a chance to really
absorb the flavor of salt and it absorbs
it all the way through and you get an
evenly seasoned chicken I like to use
boneless skinless chicken thighs for
this you can pretty much do it with any
kind of boneless chicken you really want
to serve this with something that will
absorb all those amazing pan juices what
I do is I'll get a big crusty loaf of
bread and then I'll just smoosh the
bread into the sauce as I'm eating it
absorbs it and it's just so tasty when
one side of the chicken is seared I'm
going to flip the chicken over it should
be really nicely golden brown took about
five minutes and then I'm gonna put the
whole pan in the oven probably for
another five to seven my oven is
preheated to 350
it smells done yeah nice just gonna take
this out of the pan the caramelized
garlic got really sweet but I want that
pungent garlic flavor so to get that I
have to use minced garlic saute it
lately and then a little lemon juice you
could also use white wine to deglaze the
pan but what the lemon juice does is it
gets all those little brown bits that's
where all the flavor is it brings them
up to the sauce just gonna throw the
chicken back in the pan just so it gets
nicely coated with the sauce and then
that's it don't touch the handle with
your bare hand because it was just in
the other sea anchovies totally
disappeared from view if they're in
there and we're gonna know it when we
taste it no one else will if you don't
tell them and then you really have to do
the fresh lemon juice on top if you want
a bright flavor and I always want a
bright flavor garlic capers all of it on
the same forkful mmm that came out
really well that is so good it's the
anchovies they just make the chicken
taste more like chicken they make the
capers intensified the garlic is even
sweeter
anchovies bump up the flavor of
everything else in the pan
this recipe normally serves two people
but I'm really starving so I think I'm
going to eat this whole thing as soon as
I can find where's my bread
